comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of May 21, 1922 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9801EFDB1339E133A... indicates that "Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Wright Harriman of 4 East Seventy-ninth Street, announce the engagement of their daughter, Miss Miriam Harriman" and that Harriman was President of Harriman National Bank. So presumably this is Mrs. Joseph Wright Harriman and daughter Miriam.

comment.author: 46308105@N04
comment._content: I am the great grandson of Miriam Harriman - She did not marry A.L. Hoffman. Article: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E02E7DA1139EF3AB.... She did marry Boykin Cabell Wright. Article: www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,880922,00.html#... Married. Miriam Harriman, daughter of Joseph Wright Harriman, president of the Harriman National Bank, Manhattan; to Boykin Cabell Wright of the famed Virginia "Cabells, lawyer, assistant to Herbert Hoover at the Peace Conference; in St. Bartholomew's Church, Manhattan.
